intro: Rondeletia hameliifolia, commonly known as the golden rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soil.
